61011.name: Passerby's Rejuvenated Wooden Hairstick
61011.description: A withered twig that was used as a hairstick, with new flower buds sprouting on the end. Now, the past is long gone, and the stick inlaid with parcel-gilt flower buds commemorates the beginning of a new life.
61011.four: At the start of the battle, immediately regenerates 1 Skill Point.

61012.name: Passerby's Roaming Dragon Bracer
61012.description: Bracers made from flowing coral gold and the leather of unknown beasts. Only master artisans from the Vidyadhara dragon race can create this kind of superior armor.
61012.four: At the start of the battle, immediately regenerates 1 Skill Point.

61013.name: Passerby's Ragged Embroided Coat
61013.description: An old coat with a ragged hemline. The embroidery has been ruined by blade marks. Flesh heals quickly, but a coat does not, nor does a person's pain.
61013.four: At the start of the battle, immediately regenerates 1 Skill Point.

61014.name: Passerby's Stygian Hiking Boots
61014.description: A durable pair of boots that have left shoe-prints on many worlds and have witnessed many lethal situations.
61014.four: At the start of the battle, immediately regenerates 1 Skill Point.

61021.name: Musketeer's Wild Wheat Felt Hat
61021.description: A cowboy hat decorated with wild wheat â€” a mark of the legendary Musketeer Oakley.
61021.four: The wearer's SPD increases by **6%** and Basic ATK DMG increases by **10%**.

61022.name: Musketeer's Coarse Leather Gloves
61022.description: A pair of leather gloves with partially cracked surfaces. The part where one holds a gun is particularly worn out.
61022.four: The wearer's SPD increases by **6%** and Basic ATK DMG increases by **10%**.

61023.name: Musketeer's Wind-Hunting Shawl
61023.description: A knitted cape in an ethnic style, lined with bulletproof fibers.
61023.four: The wearer's SPD increases by **6%** and Basic ATK DMG increases by **10%**.

61024.name: Musketeer's Rivets Riding Boots
61024.description: These riding boots have a V-shaped cutout. Appearing casual and loose, they are also very comfortable to wear.
61024.four: The wearer's SPD increases by **6%** and Basic ATK DMG increases by **10%**.

61031.name: Knight's Forgiving Casque
61031.description: A casque that resembles the religious stone statues of the Goddess of Forgiveness. It was used to hide the wearer's appearance.
61031.four: Increases the max DMG that can be absorbed by the Shield created by the wearer by **20%**.

61032.name: Knight's Silent Oath Ring
61032.description: A silver ring decorated with an ecclesiastical pattern, embedded with a rather cloudy gemstone.
61032.four: Increases the max DMG that can be absorbed by the Shield created by the wearer by **20%**.

61033.name: Knight's Solemn Breastplate
61033.description: A heavy breastplate decorated with the distinctive symbols of the Church of Purity Palace. Even the joints are airtight.
61033.four: Increases the max DMG that can be absorbed by the Shield created by the wearer by **20%**.

61034.name: Knight's Iron Boots of Order
61034.description: Standard boots distributed to the Knights of the Church of Purity Palace, with a simple word carved on their heels: Order.
61034.four: Increases the max DMG that can be absorbed by the Shield created by the wearer by **20%**.

61041.name: Hunter's Artaius Hood
61041.description: A hood made from the head of a huge Snow Plains bear. The fur seems to be possessed by some ghost or deity, making it invulnerable to physical attacks.
61041.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their CRIT DMG increases by **25%** for **2** turn(s).

61042.name: Hunter's Lizard Gloves
61042.description: A pair of tactical gloves, on which scaly claws of snowrock lizards are tightly sewn. It can be used to safely climb up and hang on to any wall.
61042.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their CRIT DMG increases by **25%** for **2** turn(s).

61043.name: Hunter's Ice Dragon Cloak
61043.description: A cloak made from the fine scales of the Ice Dragon, nearly invisible under the brilliant refraction of light.
61043.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their CRIT DMG increases by **25%** for **2** turn(s).

61044.name: Hunter's Soft Elkskin Boots
61044.description: A pair of enhanced power boots wrapped in soft elk fur. With these, the hunter will only leave shallow footprints behind in the Snow Plains.
61044.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their CRIT DMG increases by **25%** for **2** turn(s).

61051.name: Champion's Headgear
61051.description: Boxing headgear that provides excellent protection. It perfectly fits the shape of the owner's face.
61051.four: After the wearer attacks or is hit, their ATK increases by **5%** for the rest of the battle. This effect can stack up to **5** time(s).

61052.name: Champion's Heavy Gloves
61052.description: A pair of boxing gloves kept in excellent condition. Some slight wear doesn't hinder their effectiveness.
61052.four: After the wearer attacks or is hit, their ATK increases by **5%** for the rest of the battle. This effect can stack up to **5** time(s).

61053.name: Champion's Chest Guard
61053.description: A boxer's professional-level chest guard. The outer and inner padding is designed to provide protection while not hindering movement.
61053.four: After the wearer attacks or is hit, their ATK increases by **5%** for the rest of the battle. This effect can stack up to **5** time(s).

61054.name: Champion's Fleetfoot Boots
61054.description: Intricately crafted from leather and mesh, the combination of a thick insole and thin outsole ensures the wearer can be agile on their feet.
61054.four: After the wearer attacks or is hit, their ATK increases by **5%** for the rest of the battle. This effect can stack up to **5** time(s).

61061.name: Guard's Cast Iron Helmet
61061.description: A standard-issue helmet that covers the head and face. It has lining inside to help keep its wearer warm.
61061.four: At the beginning of the turn, if the wearer's HP is equal to or less than **50%**, restores HP equal to **8%** of their Max HP and regenerates **5** Energy.

61062.name: Guard's Shining Gauntlets
61062.description: Metal gauntlets that give off a silvery sparkle. A complex mechanical structure is hidden within its design.
61062.four: At the beginning of the turn, if the wearer's HP is equal to or less than **50%**, restores HP equal to **8%** of their Max HP and regenerates **5** Energy.

61063.name: Guard's Uniform of Old
61063.description: A neatly-ironed uniform of the Silvermane Guards from long ago. The sturdy buttons press creases in the fabric.
61063.four: At the beginning of the turn, if the wearer's HP is equal to or less than **50%**, restores HP equal to **8%** of their Max HP and regenerates **5** Energy.

61064.name: Guard's Silver Greaves
61064.description: A pair of hard, silver-white metal greaves. They provide protection while also being lightweight and warm.
61064.four: At the beginning of the turn, if the wearer's HP is equal to or less than **50%**, restores HP equal to **8%** of their Max HP and regenerates **5** Energy.

61071.name: Firesmith's Obsidian Goggles
61071.description: Protective goggles crafted from dark-black fire crystals. Through these lenses, even the flurry of intense sparks becomes a mosaic of dull shadows.
61071.four: Increases the wearer's Skill DMG by **12%**. After unleashing Ultimate, increases the wearer's Fire DMG by **12%** for the next attack.

61072.name: Firesmith's Ring of Flame-Mastery
61072.description: A ring with a symbol of flames. It is the highest symbol of honor among the Firesmith clan.
61072.four: Increases the wearer's Skill DMG by **12%**. After unleashing Ultimate, increases the wearer's Fire DMG by **12%** for the next attack.

61073.name: Firesmith's Fireproof Apron
61073.description: A blacksmith's apron without any superfluous adornment. The texture of the leather and the family emblem are clearly visible.
61073.four: Increases the wearer's Skill DMG by **12%**. After unleashing Ultimate, increases the wearer's Fire DMG by **12%** for the next attack.

61074.name: Firesmith's Alloy Leg
61074.description: A prosthetic produced from metallic alloy. Its surface is entwined with vivid fiery carvings.
61074.four: Increases the wearer's Skill DMG by **12%**. After unleashing Ultimate, increases the wearer's Fire DMG by **12%** for the next attack.

61081.name: Genius's Ultraremote Sensing Visor
61081.description: A pair of communication goggles embedded with ultraremote sensing technology that breaks through the shackles of limited transmission and remote distances.
61081.four: When the wearer deals DMG to the target enemy, ignores **10%** DEF. If the target enemy has Quantum Weakness, the wearer additionally ignores **10%** DEF.

61082.name: Genius's Frequency Catcher
61082.description: A pair of gloves equipped with a precision frequency-capture device, which enables direct manipulation of otherwise-intangible sound and light vibrations.
61082.four: When the wearer deals DMG to the target enemy, ignores **10%** DEF. If the target enemy has Quantum Weakness, the wearer additionally ignores **10%** DEF.

61083.name: Genius's Metafield Suit
61083.description: Diving-suit-like attire that envelops the body when activated, sending neural signals from your whole body to the metafield in real time.
61083.four: When the wearer deals DMG to the target enemy, ignores **10%** DEF. If the target enemy has Quantum Weakness, the wearer additionally ignores **10%** DEF.

61084.name: Genius's Gravity Walker
61084.description: A wearable gravity-capture device. It is shaped like a pair of ice skates that reflects the stars' twinkling lights during quick gliding.
61084.four: When the wearer deals DMG to the target enemy, ignores **10%** DEF. If the target enemy has Quantum Weakness, the wearer additionally ignores **10%** DEF.

61091.name: Band's Polarized Sunglasses
61091.description: A pair of classic sunglasses worn by one of the lead singers, Janis, whose chrome lenses reflect a blue hue.
61091.four: When the wearer uses their Skill, increases the wearer's ATK by **20%** for **1** turn(s).

61092.name: Band's Touring Bracelet
61092.description: Bassist Sid's bracelet, woven from silk wristbands from tours. Several lines of lyrics are written on it.
61092.four: When the wearer uses their Skill, increases the wearer's ATK by **20%** for **1** turn(s).

61093.name: Band's Leather Jacket With Studs
61093.description: David, one of the band's lead singers, drew a white star on the back of this leather jacket and made it the cover of the band's final album.
61093.four: When the wearer uses their Skill, increases the wearer's ATK by **20%** for **1** turn(s).

61094.name: Band's Ankle Boots With Rivets
61094.description: Drummer Bonham's ankle boots, the dark leather surface glued with rivets reflecting the stage lights.
61094.four: When the wearer uses their Skill, increases the wearer's ATK by **20%** for **1** turn(s).

61101.name: Eagle's Beaked Helmet
61101.description: An aerodynamic helmet used in high-speed flights. It is shaped like the beak of a skyfish eagle.
61101.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their action is Advanced Forward by **25%**.

61102.name: Eagle's Soaring Ring
61102.description: A ring worn by an outstanding skyfisher master, with a pair of skyfish eagle's wings holding tight the wearer's finger.
61102.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their action is Advanced Forward by **25%**.

61103.name: Eagle's Winged Suit Harness
61103.description: A belt harness that connects the winged suit with metal supports embedded in thick linen. Soft and tight-fitting.
61103.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their action is Advanced Forward by **25%**.

61104.name: Eagle's Quilted Puttees
61104.description: Puttees to keep the legs warm during flights, decorated with a skyfish eagle's bristle feathers.
61104.four: After the wearer uses their Ultimate, their action is Advanced Forward by **25%**.

61111.name: Thief's Myriad-Faced Mask
61111.description: A mask used to change one's facial appearance. Coupled with evocative acting skills, it can help you deceive anyone.
61111.four: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. After the wearer inflicts Weakness Break on an enemy, regenerates **3** Energy.

61112.name: Thief's Gloves With Prints
61112.description: A pair of special gloves interlaced with nanomaterials. The prints on its surface can change in real time.
61112.four: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. After the wearer inflicts Weakness Break on an enemy, regenerates **3** Energy.

61113.name: Thief's Steel Grappling Hook
61113.description: A steel cable disguised as a woven belt, with hooks and pulleys hidden in its buckle.
61113.four: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. After the wearer inflicts Weakness Break on an enemy, regenerates **3** Energy.

61114.name: Thief's Meteor Boots
61114.description: A pair of boots that enhances any human's physical prowess. It helps the Meteor Thief stride between buildings.
61114.four: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. After the wearer inflicts Weakness Break on an enemy, regenerates **3** Energy.

61121.name: Wastelander's Breathing Mask
61121.description: A breathing mask able to filter sand and radiation out from the air. It seems like it was made from a discarded respirator.
61121.four: When attacking debuffed enemies, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **10%**, and their CRIT DMG increases by **20%** against Imprisoned enemies.

61122.name: Wastelander's Desert Terminal
61122.description: Multi-functional trash that can detect ionizing radiation in the air. It can also trash-talk.
61122.four: When attacking debuffed enemies, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **10%**, and their CRIT DMG increases by **20%** against Imprisoned enemies.

61123.name: Wastelander's Friar Robe
61123.description: A baggy robe adapted from a missionary's attire.
61123.four: When attacking debuffed enemies, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **10%**, and their CRIT DMG increases by **20%** against Imprisoned enemies.

61124.name: Wastelander's Powered Greaves
61124.description: The leg part of powered armor, an exoskeleton made from scrap metals and old wires.
61124.four: When attacking debuffed enemies, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **10%**, and their CRIT DMG increases by **20%** against Imprisoned enemies.

61131.name: Disciple's Prosthetic Eye
61131.description: An ingenium eye that once belonged to someone. After being expelled from its owner's body, it is now completely useless.
61131.four: When the wearer is hit or has their HP consumed by an ally or themselves, their CRIT Rate increases by **8%** for **2** turn(s) and up to **2** stacks.

61132.name: Disciple's Ingenium Hand
61132.description: An ingenium prosthetic limb made specifically for long-life species. Requires no invasive procedure to use.
61132.four: When the wearer is hit or has their HP consumed by an ally or themselves, their CRIT Rate increases by **8%** for **2** turn(s) and up to **2** stacks.

61133.name: Disciple's Dewy Feather Garb
61133.description: A feather garb made according to old scrolls. Its owner was either a demon reviled in the pages of history or a savior of humanity.
61133.four: When the wearer is hit or has their HP consumed by an ally or themselves, their CRIT Rate increases by **8%** for **2** turn(s) and up to **2** stacks.

61134.name: Disciple's Celestial Silk Sandals
61134.description: A pair of silk boots with soles as thin as cicada's wings. Its owner must not have walked on their feet for a long time.
61134.four: When the wearer is hit or has their HP consumed by an ally or themselves, their CRIT Rate increases by **8%** for **2** turn(s) and up to **2** stacks.

61141.name: Messenger's Holovisor
61141.description: The shape is exactly like a ski goggle. Not only does it have anti-glare properties, it can also be used to watch virtual live streams.
61141.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, SPD for all allies increases by **12%** for **1** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61142.name: Messenger's Transformative Arm
61142.description: A cybernetic prosthetic arm that can be disassembled at will. Capable of firing knuckles like bullets.
61142.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, SPD for all allies increases by **12%** for **1** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61143.name: Messenger's Secret Satchel
61143.description: A trendy courier satchel. It's adorned with many cute accessories.
61143.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, SPD for all allies increases by **12%** for **1** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61144.name: Messenger's Par-kool Sneakers
61144.description: A pair of sneakers that support parkour activities. It is comfortable, and that is all it needs.
61144.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, SPD for all allies increases by **12%** for **1** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61151.name: Grand Duke's Crown of Netherflame
61151.description: A crown of unceasing flame, with its burning ambition serving as its inexhaustible fuel.
61151.two: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by **20%**.
61151.four: When the wearer uses follow-up attacks, increases the wearer's ATK by **6%** for every time the follow-up attack deals DMG. This effect can stack up to **8** time(s) and lasts for **3** turn(s). This effect is removed the next time the wearer uses a follow-up attack.
61151.twos: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by 20%.

61152.name: Grand Duke's Gloves of Fieryfur
61152.description: Pure white gloves with flames as its fur, hiding its brutality under smooth silk.
61152.two: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by **20%**.
61152.four: When the wearer uses follow-up attacks, increases the wearer's ATK by **6%** for every time the follow-up attack deals DMG. This effect can stack up to **8** time(s) and lasts for **3** turn(s). This effect is removed the next time the wearer uses a follow-up attack.
61152.twos: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by 20%.

61153.name: Grand Duke's Robe of Grace
61153.description: A gorgeous robe that emphasizes the dignity and elegance of its owner.
61153.two: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by **20%**.
61153.four: When the wearer uses follow-up attacks, increases the wearer's ATK by **6%** for every time the follow-up attack deals DMG. This effect can stack up to **8** time(s) and lasts for **3** turn(s). This effect is removed the next time the wearer uses a follow-up attack.
61153.twos: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by 20%.

61154.name: Grand Duke's Ceremonial Boots
61154.description: A pair of classic and comfortable boots in pristine condition, with a sleek design and flattering style.
61154.two: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by **20%**.
61154.four: When the wearer uses follow-up attacks, increases the wearer's ATK by **6%** for every time the follow-up attack deals DMG. This effect can stack up to **8** time(s) and lasts for **3** turn(s). This effect is removed the next time the wearer uses a follow-up attack.
61154.twos: Increases the DMG dealt by follow-up attacks by 20%.

61161.name: Prisoner's Sealed Muzzle
61161.description: A muzzle designed to tightly encage the captive's beastly visage, guarding against the feral fangs that yearn to inflict harm.
61161.four: For every DoT the target enemy is afflicted with, the wearer will ignore **6%** of its DEF when dealing DMG to it. This effect is valid for a max of **3** DoTs.

61162.name: Prisoner's Leadstone Shackles
61162.description: Heavy shackles that tightly bind the evildoer's hands with steel needles pinning into the wrists, preventing the vicious claws from doing harm again.
61162.four: For every DoT the target enemy is afflicted with, the wearer will ignore **6%** of its DEF when dealing DMG to it. This effect is valid for a max of **3** DoTs.

61163.name: Prisoner's Repressive Straitjacket
61163.description: A prisoner's garment that restrains dangerous criminals. Its reversed-joint design confines the prisoner's body.
61163.four: For every DoT the target enemy is afflicted with, the wearer will ignore **6%** of its DEF when dealing DMG to it. This effect is valid for a max of **3** DoTs.

61164.name: Prisoner's Restrictive Fetters
61164.description: Metal shackles that bind the feet of the beasts, imprisoning evils and preventing them from escaping and wrecking havoc.
61164.four: For every DoT the target enemy is afflicted with, the wearer will ignore **6%** of its DEF when dealing DMG to it. This effect is valid for a max of **3** DoTs.

61171.name: Pioneer's Heatproof Shell
61171.description: A heavy diving helmet in a style common in Orkron. Through the small porthole, one can only see the unbearable expanse of darkness.
61171.two: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by **12%**.
61171.four: Increases CRIT Rate by **4%**. The wearer's attacks against enemies with at least **2**/**4** debuffs deal **8%**/**12%** CRIT DMG. Upon inflicting a debuff on an enemy, this skill's CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG bonuses are doubled for **1** turn(s).
61171.twos: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by 12%.

61172.name: Pioneer's Lacuna Compass
61172.description: A compass in the form of a wristwatch. The magnetic needle has been removed and can no longer point in any direction.
61172.two: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by **12%**.
61172.four: Increases CRIT Rate by **4%**. The wearer's attacks against enemies with at least **2**/**4** debuffs deal **8%**/**12%** CRIT DMG. Upon inflicting a debuff on an enemy, this skill's CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG bonuses are doubled for **1** turn(s).
61172.twos: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by 12%.

61173.name: Pioneer's Sealed Lead Apron
61173.description: A heavy diving suit crafted from scrap iron, airtight and impenetrable. Even its wearer often jests that it resembles more of a deep-sea coffin.
61173.two: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by **12%**.
61173.four: Increases CRIT Rate by **4%**. The wearer's attacks against enemies with at least **2**/**4** debuffs deal **8%**/**12%** CRIT DMG. Upon inflicting a debuff on an enemy, this skill's CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG bonuses are doubled for **1** turn(s).
61173.twos: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by 12%.

61174.name: Pioneer's Starfaring Anchor
61174.description: The heavy boots are formed like the anchor of a ship. Its owner is prepared to never return to the surface.
61174.two: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by **12%**.
61174.four: Increases CRIT Rate by **4%**. The wearer's attacks against enemies with at least **2**/**4** debuffs deal **8%**/**12%** CRIT DMG. Upon inflicting a debuff on an enemy, this skill's CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG bonuses are doubled for **1** turn(s).
61174.twos: Increases DMG dealt to enemies with debuff by 12%.

61181.name: Watchmaker's Telescoping Lens
61181.description: An eyepiece gilded with gold. The lens reflects the wonders from far away to help its own pierce through the illusory dreams.
61181.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, Break Effect for all allies increases by **24%** for **2** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61182.name: Watchmaker's Fortuitous Wristwatch
61182.description: A wristwatch of fine craftsmanship. It contains a unique watch face and clock hands and is said to be the symbol of good luck in the Dreamscape.
61182.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, Break Effect for all allies increases by **24%** for **2** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61183.name: Watchmaker's Illusory Formal Suit
61183.description: A splendid and luxurious formal suit with leather collars. It is magnificent and elegant and is usually reserved for formal occasions such as feasts.
61183.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, Break Effect for all allies increases by **24%** for **2** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

61184.name: Watchmaker's Dream-Concealing Dress Shoes
61184.description: A pair of elegant leather shoes. The wearer had once stealthily walked upon dreams in a mysterious form.
61184.four: When the wearer uses their Ultimate on an ally, Break Effect for all allies increases by **24%** for **2** turn(s). This effect cannot be stacked.

63015.name: Herta's Space Station
63015.description: Sealed within this plane is the Herta Space Station. Parked above The Blue, it slowly drifts along its predetermined orbit, with the silent cosmos looking like a book waiting to be read.
63015.two: Increases the wearer's ATK by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, the wearer's ATK increases by an extra **12%**.

63016.name: Herta's Wandering Trek
63016.description: Madam Herta lost all interest in the space station the moment it was complete. The station maintains a steady orbital velocity as it circles The Blue, leaving a track of its circular motion on the planet below.
63016.two: Increases the wearer's ATK by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, the wearer's ATK increases by an extra **12%**.

63025.name: The Xianzhou Luofu's Celestial Ark
63025.description: The Xianzhou Luofu floating above the seas of stars was enclosed within the sphere. Skiffs went to and fro through the Jade Gate just like the celestial movements of stars and moons. Countless people had come here to seek the secrets of immortality, only to return in disappointment.
63025.two: Increases the wearer's Max HP by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, all allies' ATK increases by **8%**.
63025.twos: Increases the wearer's Max HP by 12%.

63026.name: The Xianzhou Luofu's Ambrosial Arbor Vines
63026.description: Once, the Luofu reigned supreme over other ships in the Xianzhou fleet due to the grace of the Ambrosial Arbor. Later, when people consumed the cursed fruit of immortality, calamity was brought upon the Luofu by the Ambrosial Arbor, whose vines had already entrapped the Luofu in its firm and inseparable grip.
63026.two: Increases the wearer's Max HP by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, all allies' ATK increases by **8%**.
63026.twos: Increases the wearer's Max HP by 12%.

63035.name: The IPC's Mega HQ
63035.description: The IPC's headquarters at Pier Point is sealed within a Planar Sphere. No planet can hide from the grand business plan of the Interastral Peace Corporation. They ventured into deep space to harvest the power of the entire universe.
63035.two: Increases the wearer's Effect Hit Rate by **10%**. Meanwhile, the wearer's ATK increases by an amount that is equal to **25%** of the current Effect Hit Rate, up to a maximum of **25%**.
63035.twos: Increases the wearer's Effect Hit Rate by 10%.

63036.name: The IPC's Trade Route
63036.description: With the convenient help of the credit system, interstellar commerce was established. The Interastral Peace Corporation connected the stars with economic activity and expanded the borders of trade.
63036.two: Increases the wearer's Effect Hit Rate by **10%**. Meanwhile, the wearer's ATK increases by an amount that is equal to **25%** of the current Effect Hit Rate, up to a maximum of **25%**.
63036.twos: Increases the wearer's Effect Hit Rate by 10%.

63045.name: Belobog's Fortress of Preservation
63045.description: The Everwinter Monument, the most obvious landmark in Belobog's Administrative District, is enclosed within the plane. Those passing this monument can all feel a distant and warm gaze protecting them.
63045.two: Increases the wearer's DEF by **15%**. When the wearer's Effect Hit Rate is **50%** or higher, the wearer gains an extra **15%** DEF.

63046.name: Belobog's Iron Defense
63046.description: The Silvermane Guards of Belobog stood firmly in the icy winter storm, forming a line as they wait for the incoming assault from invaders beyond the sky. The will of the Silvermane Guards was indestructible, and their line of defense would never falter.
63046.two: Increases the wearer's DEF by **15%**. When the wearer's Effect Hit Rate is **50%** or higher, the wearer gains an extra **15%** DEF.

63055.name: Planet Screwllum's Mechanical Sun
63055.description: The plane encapsulates the core of Planet Screwllum, imprisoned in a cage composed of countless levers, pistons, and gears. The inhabitants of Planet Screwllum euphemistically refer to it as the "Steel Sun."
63055.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by **16%**. When the wearer's current CRIT DMG reaches **120%** or higher, after entering battle, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **60%** until the end of their first attack.
63055.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by 16%.

63056.name: Planet Screwllum's Ring System
63056.description: The planetary ring supports all of Planet Screwllum. Just how many are aware that the dense porous rectangular array reflects the truth about the planetary system?
63056.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by **16%**. When the wearer's current CRIT DMG reaches **120%** or higher, after entering battle, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by **60%** until the end of their first attack.
63056.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by 16%.

63065.name: Salsotto's Moving City
63065.description: Enclosed within the plane is one of Salsotto's last remaining moving cities â€” Tumbleweed. This city never stopped and barely escaped from a fate of being swallowed up either by the dark night or the midnight sun.
63065.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **8%**. When the wearer's current CRIT Rate reaches **50%** or higher, the wearer's Ultimate and follow-up attack DMG increases by **15%**.
63065.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by 8%.

63066.name: Salsotto's Terminator Line
63066.description: Planet Salsotto's own rotation stopped, and thus each cycle of its day and night seemed to last forever. People can only gain the bare minimum space for survival when they ceaselessly migrated and closely chased the ever-moving terminator line.
63066.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **8%**. When the wearer's current CRIT Rate reaches **50%** or higher, the wearer's Ultimate and follow-up attack DMG increases by **15%**.
63066.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by 8%.

63075.name: Talia's Nailscrap Town
63075.description: Enclosed within the plane is Talia's miserable desolate small town called Nailscrap. For a short-lived peace, bandits chose this place for its water supplies and built this small town out of rags, rebars, and planks.
63075.two: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **145** or higher, the wearer's Break Effect increases by an extra **20%**.
63075.twos: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by 16%.

63076.name: Talia's Exposed Electric Wire
63076.description: This is a stretch of wire scavenged from the junkyard. Despite bits of its insulation falling off, there is still some use left in it. No such thing as useless trash exists in Talia's small bandit towns.
63076.two: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by **16%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **145** or higher, the wearer's Break Effect increases by an extra **20%**.
63076.twos: Increases the wearer's Break Effect by 16%.

63085.name: Vonwacq's Island of Birth
63085.description: Teeming with plant life, Wacq Island was the most well-known island on Planet Vonwacq and is sealed within the plane. On the island was a gigantic tree called Thestang, bearing fruits that would give birth to the various kinds of the island's wildlife.
63085.two: Increases the wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by **5%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, the wearer's action is Advanced Forward by **40%** immediately upon entering battle.
63085.twos: Increases the wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by.

63086.name: Vonwacq's Islandic Coast
63086.description: On the coastline of Wacq Island, tidal waves rose and fell... This landscape remained the same for millennia and witnessed the rise and fall of civilizations just like those changing tides.
63086.two: Increases the wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by **5%**. When the wearer's SPD reaches **120** or higher, the wearer's action is Advanced Forward by **40%** immediately upon entering battle.
63086.twos: Increases the wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by.

63095.name: Taikiyan Laser Stadium
63095.description: The plane encapsulates the most advanced arena on Planet Taikiyan â€” the Taikiyan Stadium. The atmosphere is lively both inside and outside the dome as flags wave in the air. With all eyes on the arena, an exciting game of Roboball is about to kick off.
63095.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **8%**. When the wearer's current CRIT Rate reaches **70%** or higher, the wearer's Basic ATK and Skill DMG increase by **20%**.
63095.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by 8%.

63096.name: Taikiyan's Arclight Race Track
63096.description: The Taikiyan Stadium's standard race track is usually made with a metal structure covered with smooth concrete and natural wooden floors. A large amount of transparent polycarbonate material was used in the construction of the stadium to give the audience an unobstructed view of the games.
63096.two: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **8%**. When the wearer's current CRIT Rate reaches **70%** or higher, the wearer's Basic ATK and Skill DMG increase by **20%**.
63096.twos: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by 8%.

63105.name: Insumousu's Whalefall Ship
63105.description: The plane encapsulates the Insumousu Autonomous Region of Thalassa. The Xianzhou Daiyu had crashed here, inspiring the civilization of Insumousu.
63105.two: Increases the wearer's Effect RES by **10%**. When the wearer's Effect RES is at **30%** or higher, all allies' CRIT DMG increases by **10%**.
63105.twos: Increases the wearer's Effect RES by 10%.

63106.name: Insumousu's Frayed Hawser
63106.description: The fallen Xianzhou Daiyu is forever anchored in a foreign land. Perhaps it is time to untie its mooring ropes and let it return home.
63106.two: Increases the wearer's Effect RES by **10%**. When the wearer's Effect RES is at **30%** or higher, all allies' CRIT DMG increases by **10%**.
63106.twos: Increases the wearer's Effect RES by 10%.

63115.name: Glamoth's Iron Cavalry Regiment
63115.description: Encapsulated in the Planar Sphere is the renowned shapeshifting oothecae of the Glamoth Empire's Iron Cavalry. Countless silver mechas were loaded into warships and sailed to the outer edges of the galaxy to fend off the vicious Swarm from deep space.
63115.two: Increases the wearer's ATK by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD is equal to or higher than **135**/**160**, the wearer deals **12%**/**18%** more DMG.

63116.name: Glamoth's Silent Tombstone
63116.description: The flourishing Empire of Glamoth turned into dust. There was no evidence of its former glory. Only the debris of stardust, mechas, warships, and the corpses of the Swarm were left drifting in the vacuum to form a river of residua â€” preserving the original battle scene of the bloody warfronts and serving as a monument to its downfall.
63116.two: Increases the wearer's ATK by **12%**. When the wearer's SPD is equal to or higher than **135**/**160**, the wearer deals **12%**/**18%** more DMG.

63125.name: Penacony's Grand Hotel
63125.description: Encapsulated in the plane is Penacony's main structure â€” the Reverie hotel. Guests staying here will travel to a world of sweet dreams and enjoy a feast of luxury and extravagance in a seemingly omnipotent metropolis.
63125.two: Increases wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by **5%**. Increases DMG by **10%** for all other allies that are of the same Type as the wearer.
63125.twos: Increases wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by 5%.

63126.name: Penacony's Dream-Seeking Tracks
63126.description: In Penacony's dreamscape city, intricate tracks meander between buildings, supporting the Spheroids that visitors ride in, and connecting rich and diverse dreams together.
63126.two: Increases wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by **5%**. Increases DMG by **10%** for all other allies that are of the same Type as the wearer.
63126.twos: Increases wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate by 5%.
